    • Infinitec Solutions is reinventing software development for banks, insurers and corporates who are serving SME customers. Our goal is to create an ecosystem in which our partners can drive value to the SME. Our first step in this journey is to create a world-class platform and we do this by putting together the best software engineers, product managers and other specialists to reshape the way SMEs do finance.

    We are dedicated to re-inventing how “White-label software” is built.

    What will keep you challenged?

    • Designing complex user flows based on business logic
    • Leading user testing and research, translating data into tangible product enhancements
    • Prototyping for user testing and internal stakeholder feedback
    • Delivering low-to-high fidelity annotated wireframes and interactive prototypes then working with the design team to convey completed designs to our development team
    • Working closely with product managers to explore and discover our user needs, helping to pinpoint what we should build
    • Steer and lead our team of 3 designers, collaborating with them to make their work and the whole team better
    • Mentor and inspire designers, give and solicit feedback in order to continually raise our bar for quality

    What will make you succeed?

    • Solid industry experience in product design with a successful track record of shipping excellent work in fast-paced environments
    • You are able to show us a detailed portfolio of work, detailing some of your recently completed projects, taking us through the journey, challenges and process
    • Proven track record of leading, enabling and coaching small teams of designers with a focus on transparency and communication, whilst remaining hands-on
    • An understanding of the full design process, but a focus and passion for UX.
    • Detailed knowledge of a variety of design approaches, methodologies and prototyping skills
    • Excellent communication skills in English with the ability to communicate your work to a multi-location team set-up

    What do we offer?

    Besides the standard stuff like free drinks (everything you can imagine – from coffee over Club Mate to juices and 4 different kinds of beer), cereal and fruit, discounts on transportation, gym memberships and local restaurants, we offer:

    • Competitive Salary + 28 vacation days

    • Employees will still come in at least a few days a week for team collaboration and company events
    • You’ll be part of a fantastic team. We’re passionate about what we do, have fun while doing it and work with the best people in their fields

    • Light-infused, 6th-floor office in the heart of Berlin with a rooftop terrace and chill out areas, table tennis, table soccer and shower facilities as well as yoga classes, running groups etc…

    • Regular team events – we celebrate our success together
    • We believe in personal growth and development. Share your personal aims with us and let’s achieve them together!

items.content:
Product Designer

Designer
Various US States
Company: The Wirecutter
Full Time

Overview

Position may be remote, see specific states or based in Wirecutter’s NYC or LA offices)

Wirecutter, the product review and buying guide arm of The New York Times Company, is seeking an experienced Product Designer. This team is responsible for designing and building experiences and features in the CMS and the front-end of our reader-facing website. In this role, you will be tasked with researching and designing key features for our reviews, deals, the homepage, as well as new opportunities we’ve yet to explore.

You will be the sole designer on this team, which means an immense responsibility and opportunity to shape the future of the website. You’ll work together with a tightly knit team of product thinkers, editors, and engineers to shepherd and improve the core of what millions of Wirecutter readers know and love us for.

On a day-to-day basis, you’ll mostly work with a cross-functional relationship team, which includes: a product manager, project manager, and an engineering manager plus a team of engineers.

When you apply, please include a portfolio of your work, highlighting projects that focus on:

  • Balancing user needs with business goals
  • UX solutions to complex problems
  • Strong visual design that tells a story or expresses a brand

    • Responsibilities:

    Evolve and improve the core experiences on Wirecutter.com, including reviews, deals, and the homepage:
    • Collaborate closely with editorial partners to create the best expression of our journalistic values for readers
    • Embody product design thinking by bridging Wirecutter’s readers’ needs with our business goals
    • Work with the team to pose hypotheses and help design tests (qualitative and A/B) to help us validate relationship ideas before investing in them
    • Conduct research such as competitive analysis, reader interviews, and usability tests
    • Contribute to requirements and translate them into a design approach, working in collaboration with product and engineering
    • Interview internal stakeholders to inform requirements for new product offerings
    • Present findings to leadership and achieve alignment

      • Bring more narrative and personality to the website, translating the spirit of Wirecutter to useful and delightful experiences for readers:
      • Articulate what is unique about Wirecutter, and marry that to user experiences that speak to readers
      • Use research to inform your design, backing up decisions and making difficult tradeoffs when needed
      • Work closely with other product designers and the creative team to express our narrative and personality through design, interactions, thoughtful touches to our UI.
      • Deliver engineering-ready, visually and typographically coherent design that is consistent with Wirecutter’s look and feel
      • Work with engineers on the team to perform VQA for your own design work and be accountable for the visual quality of the team’s work overall

        • Contribute to the overall design and design culture at Wirecutter:
        • Communicate openly in crit sessions and throughout work, both by sharing work in progress and by giving thoughtful feedback
        • Research new patterns and technologies and experiment with new tools to keep improving Wirecutter’s design culture
        • Extend Wirecutter’s design system as needed to help us maintain consistency as our portfolio of products grows

          • Qualifications:

          • Minimum of 3 years of design experience, preferably working on a digital product.
          • Editorial design background a plus, work experience as a designer where you engaged with content
          • Strong visual and typographic sensibility
          • Deep understanding for how qualitative research and data inform product and design decisions, previous experience designing qualitative and A/B design testing
          • Ability to speak product fluently: breaking down big challenges into smaller decisions, and framing problems as tradeoff decisions (e.g. time vs. scope).
          • Enthusiasm for Wirecutter’s mission.
          • Strong interpersonal skills. Collaboration and communication are the heart of the Wirecutter.com team. On any given feature, product, design, and engineering come together at the very start, and it will be up to you to actively reach out and nurture these ties with your partners.
          • Understanding of HTML and CSS techniques
          • Able to provide samples of work that show complex and creative UX solutions, as well as extraordinary visual design
          • A great listener who loves giving and receiving honest, thoughtful feedback
          • Steadfast in defense of both the user experience and the editorial brand while also contributing to solutions that drive the business forward
          • Enjoy working on a cross-discipline team alongside editors, engineers, product managers, and other designers
          • Enjoy shipping small, quick experiments to explore or validate your ideas

            • When you apply, please include a portfolio of your work, highlighting projects that focus on:

            • Balancing user needs with business goals
            • UX solutions to complex problems
            • Strong visual design that tells a story or expresses a brand

              • Wirecutter is a list of the best products for people who don’t want to take a lot of time figuring out what to get. It was founded in September 2011, and it became a part of The New York Times Company in October 2016.

              The company’s purpose: to help people find great things, quickly and easily. Through rigorous testing, research, reporting, and whatever means necessary, they create straightforward recommendations that save readers from unnecessary stress, time, and effort. We then monetize these reviews through enabling our readers to easily purchase the products they are interested in.

              The New York Times Company is making a sizable investment to accelerate growth of the business. Wirecutter aims to expand this business by improving performance of existing product categories while applying Wirecutter product review approach to new product categories, in addition to exploring new revenue opportunities in commerce.

              Even with offices in New York City and Los Angeles, Wirecutter remains a highly remote culture, and open to employing people across the country.  Right now, we are eligible to hire residents in these states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Massachusetts, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Carolina, New Hampshire, Nevada, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Virginia, Washington.

              The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

              The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.



              To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

              Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

items.content:
Graphic Designer (Web & Print)

Company: PixelHaus Media

About This Opportunity:

We’re on the hunt for a kickass Junior Graphic Designer to join our team: someone who is creative and motivated, who can turn our visions into highly effective brand imagery.

As our in-house designer, you'll be confident and comfortable taking constructive criticism and also questioning briefs. The ideal candidate is organized handling designs, briefs and manages their time wisely and efficiently. You'll demonstrate your ability to contribute on brand ideas for our client portfolio.

Do you have a crush on visual design, a curious mindset and want to develop your skills? Do you have a great feel for UI/UX and know how to create visual content for social media? Then we want to hear from you!  

Responsibilities:

  • The Junior Graphic Designer will be expected to perform the following functions:

  • Create and define brand guidelines

  • Conceptualise, design and produce all marketing material from inception to production

  • Producing ads for social media ad campaigns

  • Designing graphics to be used in emails and on site pages

  • Designing and producing email templates and landing pages

  • Manage packaging designs along with production quality management

  • Assist all business needs through creative graphics and visual content creation

Required Skills and Experience:

  • +1 years of experience working as a graphic designer

  • Must have great working knowledge of Indesign, Photoshop, Illustrator

  • Expertise in brand guidelines

  • Experience with creating visual content for social media

  • Ability to code what you dream up in HTML, CSS, and JS is a big bonus!

  • Meticulous attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills across all levels of business

  • Ability to work under pressure and able to deliver under strict deadlines

  • Flexibility to work in fast-moving and changing environment with varying tasks, responsibilities and key stakeholders

  • Ability to contribute to an entrepreneurial, innovative and collaborative team-based environment.

  • Fluent in English



What PixelHaus offers:

  • Competitive compensation

  • A ridiculously awesome work environment - equal parts laid-back startup and motivated meritocracy

  • Option to work remotely and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy)

  • Enjoy face-to-face time with the whole team on all-expense paid retreats 2x year



Looking forward to hearing from you! 

How to apply:
Please apply here: https://www.pixelhaus.media/junior-graphic-designer

items.content:
Product and UX Designer at Participatory Culture Foundation

Remote | Freelance | International | Part-time

Participatory Culture Foundation (PCF) is seeking a creative individual who is passionate about designing highly usable and innovative software. Our ideal candidate is curious, organized, and has a desire to make the world a better place!

PCF is a nonprofit working to build a more open, collaborative, and inclusive world. Our flagship initiative, Amara, is a platform for collaborative subtitling and translation of video. Individuals and communities, as well as some of the largest companies, from around the world use Amara to subtitle video. The platform has enabled tens of millions of viewers to fully engage with videos that would otherwise be inaccessible!

The PCF team is fully distributed across 6 countries and communicates through chat applications, emails, and video conferences. We are looking for someone who is able to work well independently, is self-motivated, and has great attention to detail. Our new designer will help cultivate a user-centered design culture in a 100% remote organization.

The position is part-time, contract-to-hire beginning at 12-20 hours per week with possibilities for growth.

Responsibilities

  • Gain a deep understanding of the user-experience for Amara (a SaaS solution for captioning and translating video)
  • Define problems, map user journeys, prototype interactions
  • Work closely with Product Manager and Engineering team to turn designs into functional software
  • Seek out and coordinate feedback on designs and prototypes from internal and external stakeholders throughout an iterative design process
  • Champion both users and the engineering team’s needs and constraints
  • Conduct design research to identify new user needs and better understand known issues

Qualifications

Required

  • At least 3 years experience in product and UX design
  • A strong portfolio that illustrates your experience and skillset
  • Foundation in interactive design tools
  • Experience working in a cross-functional agile team
  • Ability to deliver clean, well-thought out interface design elements
  • Ability to understand overlapping user needs and conceptualize solutions
  • Ability to work remotely and autonomously, as well as collaboratively
  • Strong communication skills

Nice to Have

  • Front end web development skills (HTML / CSS / JS)

About Amara

While internet video has exploded, language is still a significant barrier to education, economic opportunity, political participation, and other areas of cultural life. Amara connects millions of people to help break down these barriers and allows hundreds of organizations to make their content more accessible through innovative technology.

Amara is a project of the Participatory Culture Foundation (PCF), a nonprofit 501c3. We are driven by our mission to foster a media ecosystem that enables everyone to benefit from online video content. Content that can enrich lives, but is not currently available to those who cannot hear or understand the language of the video. We believe a participatory and inclusive world leads to a more understanding and caring society.

About PCF

PCF develops technology and services that ensure everyone has access to all that the internet has to offer. From the abundance of free education available, to gaining insights about the many different cultures around the globe, information is critical to building a more equitable and peaceful society.

How We Collaborate

Engineers will work closely with our Product Development & Design team to bring new features and functionality to life on the Amara platform.

Amara and PCF is based out of Massachusetts, but the team is global and works virtually. You’ll be collaborating with a talented and passionate team striving to make positive social impact.

The team uses chat and video apps (Skype, Slack, Google Hangouts) as well as email for internal communication. Please note that the team has members working in both US and European timezones, so those in UTC +0 to +4 are especially encouraged to apply.

We are an inclusive workplace, where all team members have a voice. We encourage participation and engagement. Our diversity in backgrounds and life experiences makes us unique and helps us innovate. On our team you’ll find incredibly talented professionals who are also musicians, avid dessert connoisseurs, beer brewers, pet fanciers, master chess players, gardeners, and many other stripes!

Our Commitment to Diversity

The work of the Participatory Culture Foundation is strengthened by the diversity of our network and our differences in background, culture, experience, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, and much more. We welcome applications from people of color, women, the LGBTQIA community, and persons with disabilities.

Apply for job

items.content:
(Senior) Product Designer | UI/UX Designer // Yara Digital Factory

Company: Yara Digital Factory

Tags:
  • Design
  • UX
  • UI
  • Product

    • The agriculture of the future will and must be different from today’s: In 2050 there will be almost 30% more people than today, 300 qkm less farmland and greater drought periods. Become part of our mission to solve some of the world’s biggest challenges — resource scarcity, food insecurity, and environmental change!

    At our AgTech startups – and ventures of Yara International – you will enjoy a meaningful product, the culture & pace of a startup combined with serious backing & support of a leading provider of crop nutrition solutions to 20 million farmers across 160 countries.

    We’re looking for a seasoned Product Designer to help turn our mission from vision to reality. You own the product\\\’s design from the beginning to the end of product building. This is your chance to join an exciting, high growth venture and help shape the future of the least digitized industry!

    Reasons to join

    # Challenging tasks that enable you to grow & excel: you get th chance to own the design of a solution (incl. processes, standards + metrics)

    # Meaningful product: The chance to revolutionize an entire sector & change the lives of millions

    # No-Worries package: Permanent contract, generous relocation package & above average compensation package

    # Transparency: Know what\\\’s going on! We share business information openly

    # Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours, working from home/remote option + 30 days of vacation!

    # Freedom & Impact: You set up mostly everything from scratch & we\\\’re looking forward to your changes!

    # Personal development: Large development opportunities with conference budget, development budget incl. team lead position

    # Great team: Join a passionate team & fun company events like hackathons, kajaking, paintball

    Your playground

    # Act as a UI / UX leader within the product team

    # You collaborate pro-actively with PMs, Engineers on a daily basis

    # Have users realize the value provided by our product by offering a simple, usable and elegant user experience on web and mobile interfaces

    # Prototype to enable continuous collaboration with colleagues as well as frequent validation with real users

    # Develop a UI styleguide to ensure overall visual consistency of our product

    # Develop a UX guideline to ensure consistent simplicity and easy usage

    # Create user flows, wireframes, mockups, user interfaces and interactive prototypes to achieve a great user experience

    # Shorten the feedback loop by testing solutions for problems before they are implemented to limit usability risks

    # Own succes & failure of design and share learnings actively

    You’re a fit if you

    # Have several years of experience designing digital products (ideally also B2B), not just websites.

    # You have helped to design and ship products within an agile environment

    # You have worked in a team and have a good understanding how to streamline our work as a team

    # You have helped to design and ship products within an agile environment

    # Have designed experiences that people can access on any type of device: desktop, tablet, phone

    # Have a track record of optimizing the usability of a product

    # Solve challenging problems creatively while relying on \\\”build-measure-learn\\\” as well as your design skills

    # Eager to understand what users say on a deeper level

    # You are able drive ideation within an agile product development team

    # Are a feedback frantic: you give, receive and implement feedback quickly

    # MUST HAVE: speak GERMAN fluently (at least C1) and English

    While we like to read CVs, we are much more interested in you as an individual, what projects you have worked (portfolio) on in the past & what you want to achieve in the future!

    To join our team, please reach out to Claudi via Claudia.Wilms@yara.com or apply directly via the website/this platform.

    We are looking forward to meeting you :-)!

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Technical Coach (Design)

Company: Thinkful Inc.

Technical Coach (Design) 
 Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin



Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.
  • Remote .
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.
How to apply:
hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/thinkfulcom/view/P_AAAAAAEAAAxFh52aKCQ9PT

Company: Pixellu

SUMMARY
Pixellu is seeking a passionate, energetic, detail-oriented Web Designer to work alongside Pixellu’s Creative Director, UX/UI Designer, and Web Developer to design and publish new web pages forwww.pixellu.com. The ideal candidate is well versed in the latest digital media trends and is ready to join a growing, high-achieving, and self-motivated team.

LOCATION
Remote position

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develop concepts, graphics and layouts for Pixellu website that achieve visual and operational goals
  • Write website copy & content
  • Determine technical requirements
  • Strategize and develop A/B tests
  • Gather and analyze data as a basis for decision making

REQUIRED SKILLS
  • Basic knowledge of UX/UI
  • Familiar with Sketch, Invision, and Adobe software
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Accuracy and attention to detail

  • Builds rapport with Pixellu staff, third parties, and customer
  • Knowledge of the photography industry preferred

QUALIFICATIONS

ABOUT PIXELLU
We are a group of 25 passionate individuals developing software to serve thousands of professional photographers worldwide. We firmly believe that a company is only as good as its people, and we are lucky to have some of the very best employees in the world!

items.content:
Product Designer (UX and UI)

Company: Crazy Egg

Since 2005, over 300,000 websites have used Crazy Egg to understand how their audience experiences their website and their product. We are pioneers in data visualization and in helping businesses get immense value quickly and accurately from incredibly large data sets. That's what we love to do. We are looking for a Product Designer with strong UX and UI skills to help build on that foundation and take our product experience to the next level.

Crazy Egg Product Designers care about the customer experience, and do what it takes to bring that experience fully to life. You work directly with clients to determine their needs and work across the team through prototyping/development. You design user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes. You get your hands dirty doing everything from icons and logos to QA’ing final work and assisting with acceptance testing. You make sure what you discovered and designed, is delivered.

A successful team member at Crazy Egg is:
  • Direct, undeniable, customer impact. We have incredible customers that we're grateful for and we believe the best teammates are the ones who, regardless of function or discipline, are eager and excited to find a way to connect their work directly to customers.
  • Independent and interdependent. You are fully trusted as a full owner of the work you do; self-determined, responsible, accountable, and celebrated. With that freedom, you acknowledge, a broader social context. We work together, we partner, we collaborate, and we make sure the work we take on and hand off is done thoughtfully and with care.
  • Assuming positive intent. All outcomes may not be what we desired, what we expected, or what we needed. But they happened because people take chances and are willing to make decisions. We assume people try their hardest and try their best, we assume their actions started with the most positive of intentions. Every conversation, assessment, piece of feedback, starts with that assumption, on both sides. This ensures our team is built on a foundation of trust.
  • Caring and inclusive; sincerely. We work at Crazy Egg because we believe in the opportunity, we believe in the vision, we believe in our people, and we believe in our ability to build something wonderful. It is those beliefs that also mean we care about the market, we care about the vision, we care about each other, and we care about building something wonderful. When all of this falls into place, our customers are able to build better businesses and succeed.

A successful Product Designer at Crazy Egg has:
  • The ability to work across the organization (Product Leadership, Engineering, Growth) to develop new experience-focused web applications, or provide support for existing ones.
  • The knowledge of a thoughtful, balanced customer research process required to balance clear customer feedback with intuiting and addressing the unsaid or unwritten.
  • The passion to take a project from high-level concept (business requirements or functional requirements) through to implementation ready designs. Your ability to move seamlessly from InVision to Sketch to the Front End is standout.
  • The expertise on the expected (current web standards, original designs, rapid prototyping, responsive design, cross-screen/cross-device) with a commitment to staying abreast of emerging UX and UI trends as a way to keep making your work and our customer’s experience, more helpful.
  • The willingness to participate in project planning (scoping, estimating) and project review (QA, post-mortems) showcases your desire to keep improving how we work together and what we deliver to our customers.

A successful applicant for this position typically has:
  • 3+ years experience in a product design role.
  • 2+ years experience using qualitative & quantitative customer research to inform design direction.
  • 2+ years experience with the tools required for rapid prototyping and iterative design.
  • Previous remote working experience.
  • Motivation to work for a company that is bootstrapped, self-funded, and profitable for 14 years.

A successful applicant would likely have some but not all of the following:
  • Working in a startup environment
  • Working on applications that process large volumes of data and/or receive high volumes of traffic
  • Passion or desire to become more active with Front End Engineering and Development.

As a Crazy Egg team member here’s what you’ll become a part of:
  • We believe in building the best team possible, regardless of geographic location. Our team is fully remote and we believe in working where you’re the most productive and happiest.
  • We have full trust in you and believe in finding a good balance. Work should be a marathon, not a sprint, and so we offer flexible paid vacation.
  • We believe in supporting your growth and opportunity. Crazy Egg was founded 14 years ago by accomplished founders Hiten Shah and Neil Patel. If you are looking to learn what it takes to one day break off on your own and start your own startup, this is a good opportunity for you.

Direct applicants only. No recruiters or agencies please.
How to apply:
Please send an email introducing yourself to jobs@crazyegg.com. Please include the following: 1) A link to your portfolio and resume. 2) Some background on why you want to work for Crazy Egg. 3) A quick overview of your favorite product from a design standpoint, and why.

items.content:
UI/UX Designer

Company: Overlap

Overlap makes healthcare better for patients and their providers. We work with some of the world’s best healthcare institutions to help them get data from wearables and mobile apps into the clinical environment so they can manage disease more effectively.  The Overlap product line spans iOS, Android and Web and has deep data visualization components.

As our part-time UI/UX Designer, we want your experience to help turn ideas into engaging experiences that are implementable.

About you:
  • You are self-managed, know how to prioritize, meet deadlines and define deliverables.
  • You can effectively communicate and present your design thinking to teams and stakeholders
  • You can take a design from high-level concept to Sketch and Invision and static assets easily and quickly
  • You write and speak English clearly
  • Your are up-to-date on industry trends in UI and UX
  • You are honest - You know what you don’t know and you have no problem raising your hand and asking for help.
  • You’re obsessed with simplicity and consistency
  • You’re okay working across the organization (product leadership, engineering, marketing and the CEO)
  • You have knowledge of design trends in mobile and how to adapt designs across platforms
  • You have experience working with visualizing large sets of data
  • You have previous remote working experience

You will be:
  • Collaborating with Overlap’s CTO, product lead engineers and CEO to align partner needs with company goals
  • Augmenting UI and UX across our iOS, Android and Web application
  • Working-off of our existing design UI on iOS, Android and Web
  • Designing some marketing collateral and new features for the overlaphealth.com website
  • Participating in project planning and project review (QA and post-mortems)
  • Designing everything from logos to icons to QA’ing final work and assist with acceptance testing
  • Focusing on shipping a beautiful product you’re proud of

Role requirements:
  • 3+ years of experience
  • Most recent portfolio demonstrating both design skill and process across mobile and web
  • Design experience with data visualization
  • Experience in creating easy-to-use designs that display holistic thinking
  • Acute attention to detail
  • Experience with and proficiency in design and prototyping software (Sketch, Invision)
  • Stellar presentation skills
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) skills

Software skills
  • Sketch
  • Prototyping & wireframing software
  • Invision
How to apply:
Send along a resume and cover letter explaining why you’d be a good fit for Overlap and a resume. Email everything to jointheteam@overlaphealth.com, please include "UI/UX Designer” in the subject line. We look forward to hear from you!

items.content:
Web / Graphic Designer

Company: Without Code

We are seeking a part-time / contract visual designer to conceptualize and build creative assets for e-commerce websites. Assets may include complete website layouts, product promotions, and graphics for social media. The ideal candidate should have an understanding of popular trends in web design, and the ability to create diverse graphics targeting a variety of markets. Coding skills are not required for this role.

Working remotely with a young team based around the world, you’ll have the flexibility to work on a variety of projects and wear many hats within the business. This is a remote position - you’ll be required to join group calls and participate in an online project management tool, however the work can be completed from any location.

This is an ongoing contract with part-time hours required. 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Strong portfolio of web design projects
  • Excellent design skills and understanding of principles (typography, color, composition, etc.)
  • Understanding of the latest trends and usability in modern web design.
  • Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite applications is a major asset
  • Experience with UI and UX and best practices
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • Enthusiastic and willing to pitch in wherever necessary
  • Capable of working independently and on a team
  • Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills

PRIMARY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design complete websites based on provided assets and strategic objectives
  • Create product marketing assets, including thumbnails, landing pages and social media graphics
  • Photography touch-up and manipulation
  • Monitor the web for new web technologies and potential product ideas
How to apply:
Please send a resume and online portfolio to info@wocode.com

items.content:
Graphic Designer (Web & Print)

Headquarters: Amsterdam
URL: https://www.pixelhaus.media/

About This Opportunity:

We’re on the hunt for a kickass Junior Graphic Designer to join our team: someone who is creative and motivated, who can turn our visions into highly effective brand imagery.

As our in-house designer, you'll be confident and comfortable taking constructive criticism and also questioning briefs. The ideal candidate is organized handling designs, briefs and manages their time wisely and efficiently. You'll demonstrate your ability to contribute on brand ideas for our client portfolio.

Do you have a crush on visual design, a curious mindset and want to develop your skills? Do you have a great feel for UI/UX and know how to create visual content for social media? Then we want to hear from you!  

Responsibilities:

  • The Junior Graphic Designer will be expected to perform the following functions:

  • Create and define brand guidelines

  • Conceptualise, design and produce all marketing material from inception to production

  • Producing ads for social media ad campaigns

  • Designing graphics to be used in emails and on site pages

  • Designing and producing email templates and landing pages

  • Manage packaging designs along with production quality management

  • Assist all business needs through creative graphics and visual content creation

Required Skills and Experience:

  • +1 years of experience working as a graphic designer

  • Must have great working knowledge of Indesign, Photoshop, Illustrator

  • Expertise in brand guidelines

  • Experience with creating visual content for social media

  • Ability to code what you dream up in HTML, CSS, and JS is a big bonus!

  • Meticulous attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills across all levels of business

  • Ability to work under pressure and able to deliver under strict deadlines

  • Flexibility to work in fast-moving and changing environment with varying tasks, responsibilities and key stakeholders

  • Ability to contribute to an entrepreneurial, innovative and collaborative team-based environment.

  • Fluent in English



What PixelHaus offers:

  • Competitive compensation

  • A ridiculously awesome work environment - equal parts laid-back startup and motivated meritocracy

  • Option to work remotely and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy)

  • Enjoy face-to-face time with the whole team on all-expense paid retreats 2x year



Looking forward to hearing from you! 

To apply: Please apply here: https://www.pixelhaus.media/junior-graphic-designer

items.title: Stylist
items.content:
Stylist at Tailor

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Freelance. Remote. Flexible

Love fashion and working with people?

Join Tailor As A Remote Stylist!

  1. Complete our 100% online application process – no resume needed
  2. If selected, start styling quickly! Help clients style clothes they own, assess their wardrobes, and shop for new pieces
  3. Work from home and make money, while making others feel great doing what you love

Further details below.

THE DETAILS: FREELANCE STYLIST (REMOTE – US) MUST BE 18+ YEARS OLD TO APPLY

As a Tailor Virtual Stylist, you will consult with users online, leveraging your understanding of current fashion and styling trends along with user preferences and specifications. A Freelance role, this opportunity provides flexible hours and a remote, virtual work arrangement.

THE PERFECT TAILOR STYLIST:

  • Loves fashion and wants to bring that love of fashion to others.
  • Has direct, paid experience in personal styling, fashion merchandising and/or design.
  • Demonstrates strong written/oral communication skills and attention to detail.
  • Is computer-savvy and generally comfortable with technology, and has access to a reliable laptop and strong internet connection.
  • Is adaptable and excited to work on a fast-paced, evolving business.
  • Has a positive attitude and looks forward to collaborating with other remote stylists.

WHAT IS REQUIRED OF REMOTE STYLISTS:

  • You will provide thoughtful, high-quality responses to styling, shopping and general fashion questions from our diverse and growing userbase.
  • You will review all onboarding materials and resources once selected to join the Tailor team.
  • You will set up all required tools on your laptop with the guidance of the Tailor team. You will do all of your styling within the Tailor Stylist Interface from your desktop or laptop device.
  • You will set your own schedule and you will style no more than 35 hours/week.
  • You will keep up to date on developments with the product and share questions, feedback and ideas with the other stylists and the Tailor team.

APPLY

Please note: if your application is accepted, you will hear from us within approximately one month.

Apply for job

Axios is a new digital media company that gets you smarter, faster with news that matters.. We’re hiring a freelance designer!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=5, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Senior Visual Designer

Full-time
Phoenix, AZ (preferred)
Remote job
Relocation assistance
Mid-sized business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
About Us

 
Tuft & Needle is a digitally-native sleep brand. We offer high quality products for the bedroom at a fair price while providing an award-winning customer experience. Founded by an engineer and marketer from Silicon Valley, we’re a company that has iterative design and development at its core. We believe the user experience should drive development and technology should rarely dictate functionality. At the end of the day, we’re a group of nice people who work hard and value transparency, growth, and doing right by our customers. Come help us shape the future of our brand.
 
About the Role
 
Above all, we win as a team. We hire people who like working collaboratively and don’t mind getting out of their comfort zones. The majority of your role will be creating engaging and usable digital experiences for our customers throughout their shopping journey. Projects will range from product and landing pages to complex e-commerce features. You will also have the opportunity to occasionally work on heavier UX problems as well as some print projects.  
Essential Functions
  • Translating business requirements and user needs into design solutions that are engaging, valuable and usable
  • Working with project teams to distill goals, constraints and risks into well thought-out project plans
  • Helping to build and maintain our brand guidelines and UI pattern library as our brand and interfaces evolve over time
  • Art directing product pages, marketing initiatives, email campaigns, and other aesthetic- and performance-driven interfaces
  • Occasionally art directing and executing printed product collateral and retail needs
  • Collaborating with the content and multi-media teams to create integrated, engaging content for your designs
  • Leading brainstorming/wireframing sessions that use design thinking practices to ideate with multi-disciplinary teams
  • Creating mood boards, style tiles, wireframes, and comps to explore solutions and clearly communicate the recommended user experience to the project team
  • Designing intuitive and elegant web-based interfaces for all screen sizes
  • Maintaining graphic standards and branding throughout all design solutions
  • Helping to conduct and interpret user research and testing for your designs
  • Strategizing with the team on better flows and processes for existing systems
  • Providing clear, candid, and constructive feedback to team members
  • Being an ambassador for human-centered design and a champion for the user
  • Working on multiple projects in parallel while staying organized and meeting tight deadlines

 

You have experience…

 

  • Creating beautiful, engaging, usable designs
  • Providing art direction for digital projects
  • Leading brainstorming/wireframing/story-carding sessions
  • Building prototypes and conducting and interpreting user research and testing
  • Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams
  • Working with e-commerce (nice to have)
  • Working for a product company (nice to have)

You can demonstrate…

 

  • Advanced visual design skills, including typography, color theory, and illustration
  • Solid UX design skills, ranging from user research to high-fidelity comps
  • Solid UI animation skills and comfort working with modern prototyping tools
  • Complex problem-solving skills
  • Advocacy for the user
  • A bias toward testing and a curiosity for what you don’t know
  • Flexibility (high-fidelity and low-fidelity, changing objectives and scope, etc)
  • Comfort working at a quick yet sustainable pace
  • An ability to manage large projects while staying organized and focused
  • An ability to give and receive constructive feedback
  • An ability to listen and ask good questions
  • The confidence and initiative to speak up and address problems that you see within our products, processes, and teams
  • Familiarity with Google analytics (nice to have)
  • Basic coding skills (HAML/SASS) (nice to have)

You value…

 

  • The human-centered design process
  • Collaboration and feedback
  • Working iteratively
  • Working with non-designers
  • Putting users first
  • Minimal design
  • Continuous learning and growth
  • Sharing knowledge and mentoring others

 

 

We believe that diversity makes us better. Tuft & Needle is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability or any other legally protected status.

items.content:
Senior Designer and UX Strategist at Axelerant

Remote

Anywhere in Asia/Africa/Eastern Europe/Latin America (Remote), Multiple Countries

Full-Time

Service Delivery

Experienced

Description

Axelerant is seeking a Senior Designer & UX Strategist to design the interactions and own the digital experiences of its products and services.

We are looking for innovators; professionals with an unrelenting belief in the power of design to transform businesses, and with the passion and commitment to help Axelerant become recognized for elegant and powerful

You’ll play an influential role in our projects, creating visual designs informed by UX and strategy documents. You’ll collaborate with diverse clients, inspiring designers, top-notch project managers and seasoned developers.

Requirements

  • Deliver best-in-class user experiences (user interface designs, interaction models, prototypes, etc.), in a fast-paced, agile, startup-like environment
  • Partner with our Product Managers to prioritize UX-focused efforts
  • Fully understand and be a strong advocate for the Voice of the Customer
  • Lead rapid iterative prototyping efforts with varying fidelity/presentation tools (e.g., sketches, storyboards, wireframes, clickable prototypes, compositions, and assets)
  • Translate business and product requirements into visually beautiful concepts and highly-usable responsive experiences. You must be flexible and able to succeed within an open and collaborative peer environment.
  • Identify strategic research needs and Customer Experience improvement opportunities
  • Mentor junior team members
  • Develop and ensure best design practices and communicate quality expectations across the organization
  • Spend time with Axelerant customers, prospects, partners, and internal stakeholders to understand user needs and evaluate designs
  • Demonstrate a command of design methods, tools, communication, and presentation skills

Required Skills

  • 5+ years experience in a UX/UI design role
  • A thorough understanding of user-centered design, with excellent hands-on graphic design skills and an ability to translate user requirements into a design vision and then into an actionable plan to deliver design specifications desired
  • Proficiency in software tools such as Sketch, Axure, Adobe Creative Suite or similar
  • Experience with enterprise software development, cloud software, product management, user testing or experience with Drupal will also be a plus
  • Experience with designing data visualization and analytics applications
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize requests, communicate with stakeholders, and meet expected milestones
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, agile environment and partnering effectively with Product Management and Engineering stakeholders
  • Online portfolio or links to work examples required

About Axelerant

  • At days end Axelerant is an enthusiastic, open, and giving software company of empowered and distributed teams who leverage and contribute to open source software to help clients with their mission. We provide high-end strategy, implementation, and support services for our partners.
  • Our team members span the world and we follow agile delivery processes. Further, we’re actively giving back to many open source communities and have fostered an innovative, incubator culture to give ideas a chance to succeed.

Perks of Being at Axelerant

  • 52 weekends and 35 days per year of consolidated leave (inclusive of bereavement leave) plus maternity, paternity, and sabbatical allowances.
  • Our BYOD assistance terms are simple. We’ll cover 50% of purchase or repair costs up to 50,000 INR.
  • Annual retreats, quarterly town halls, and monthly celebrations.
  • Group health insurance.
  • An engaged working environment with frequent feedback and clearly set expectations.
  • Extremely flexible work hours.
  • Hackathons and community contributions.
  • Professional development, certifications, and training.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • Sponsored domestic and international event attendance.
  • Work from home or anywhere via location independence.
Apply for job

items.content:
Web Design Sales at Hostcopper

Houston, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$24K–$35K
30.0%–40.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Location : United States (located anywhere)
Position: Outside Sales
Full-Time or Part Time

Job Description
Hostcopper is a leading provider in the Web Hosting industry. We are looking for employees that want to grow long term with the company. We are a start up company that is expanding rapidly. We contribute to your success and being happy as a employee. This is a commission based position.

Candidate
A ideal candidate we are looking for can be part time or full time. That has retail or sales experience.

Function:
Development of new business within the web hosting and web design industry and run all business development activities.
This is a head hunting role business to business sales.

Responsibilities:
Increase customer base and develop customer contacts.
Sell and promote web design services and web hosting to provide maximum exposure of the companies image.
Manage the entire sales process involved with selling web design services to new clients (prospecting, territory management, meeting scheduling, product demonstrations, objection handling, contract negotiation).
Develop relationships with individual customers and sell to all types of industries.
Provides management with complete, current and accurate data on applicable customer activity.
Demonstrate effectiveness by consistently hitting (and exceeding) monthly, quarterly and yearly objectives.
Provides input to development of business goals and assess recommendations for new business areas and opportunities.
Drive penetration into assigned markets through various means including email, telephone.

Required Qualifications:
Minimum of 1 year business development in sales or retail sales experience.
Ability to recognize opportunities and utilize sales experience to successfully negotiate and close deals within the Web Hosting/Web Design Industry.
Ged or high school diploma required.
Strong leadership, behavior traits and a desire to succeed.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Compensation is based on your performance, so your efforts determine your rewards. We offer a great benefits package, 401k, room for advancement.

items.content:
UI Designer


Numbrs Personal Finance AG

**UI Designer - Remote**

The Numbrs Personal Finance AG is a global leading technology company. Our product is Numbrs, one of the most widely used banking apps in Germany.
The app provide millions of users with the best technology platform for easily managing their personal finances and assets. Numbrs is one of the best funded FinTechs worldwide, backed by renowned investors.

The Numbrs business division solves some of the most complex business problems in the financial industry today. We are a team of professional, hard-working, supportive and entrepreneurial individuals with a passion for execution, headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland.

We are seeking professionals who can thrive in a fast-paced environment where attention to details, excellent communication skills, and a talent for delivering out-of-the-box ideas are essential. Do you want to have a real impact on the future of the financial industry? Join Numbrs.

**Job Description**

As our UI Designer, you will work on creating the visual language for our app Numbrs and also work on other products that we develop within our company. Your responsibility will also be to create outstanding user interface designs and brand experiences for our products. By delivering pixel-perfect designs, interaction prototypes, and design guidelines, you will become an important part of the production process. You will work closely with UX Designers, engineering teams and Product Owners to develop and ship new features for our product.

**Location: Remote**

Responsibilities

**Job Description**As our UI Designer, you will work on creating the visual language for our app Numbrs and also work on other products that we develop within our company. Your responsibility will also be to create outstanding user interface designs and brand experiences for our products. By delivering pixel-perfect designs, interaction prototypes, and design guidelines, you will become an important part of the production process. You will work closely with UX Designers, engineering teams and Product Owners to develop and ship new features for our product.

Requirements

**All candidates will have*** a Bachelor's or higher degree or equivalent work experience in graphic and user interface design* knowledge and hands-on experience in building outstanding products in a professional environment* experience in working on native mobile products for both iOS and Android* ability to prototype interactions and animations* comfortable in using the latest design tools: Sketch, Principle, Adobe Creative Suite etc.* excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities* excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills**Ideally, candidates will also have*** experience in leading projects or initiatives to continuously improve the design process

See more jobs at Numbrs Personal Finance AG

As our UI Designer, you will work on creating the visual language for our app Numbrs and also work on other products that we develop within our company. Your responsibility will also be to create outstanding user interface designs and brand experiences for our products. By delivering pixel-perfect designs, interaction prototypes, and design guidelines, you will become an important part of the production process. You will work closely with UX Designers, engineering teams and Product Owners to develop and ship new features for our product.

All candidates will have

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree or equivalent work experience in graphic and user interface design
  • knowledge and hands-on experience in building outstanding products in a professional environment
  • experience in working on native mobile products for both iOS and Android
  • ability to prototype interactions and animations
  • comfortable in using the latest design tools: Sketch, Principle, Adobe Creative Suite etc.
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

Ideally, candidates will also have

  • experience in leading projects or initiatives to continuously improve the design process

Location: Remote

Apply here

items.content:
Senior Product Designer (Consumer; Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Designer
Industry: Online Travel, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Scott's Cheap Flights | No office location

Technologies

html
css
webflow
sketch-3

Job description

We’re obsessed with helping people see the world for far less money than they ever thought possible.

Our business model is simple: our team of flight experts search for incredible deals on international flights 24/7. When we find a cheap flight that passes our stringent quality standards (factors include ticket price, itinerary, airline reputation and extra fees and more), we email members with details and booking instructions. Our vision is to be the first place people turn when planning or booking an international trip.

Over 1,500,000 members around the world!

Since opening our platform to the public in 2015, more than 1,500,000 people around the world have joined and saved over $100,000,000 on international flights!

We work remotely.

We’re a 100% remote company, with team members distributed around the globe in over a dozen countries. Please note: While this role is open to candidates located anywhere, we do require several hours a day of availability during Pacific Time for team collaboration and sprint meetings as much of our team is based in the USA.

Sound like a good fit?

If you’re happiest and do you best work on a remote team alongside a small and talented team of travel aficionados, Scott’s Cheap Flights might be the perfect fit for you.

Curious to learn more?

Check out Scott's $1,000 round-the-world journey and read more from our community. You can also listen to an in-depth podcast on Indie Hacker: Building a Million Dollar Mailing List with Scott of Scott's Cheap Flights on how he grew the business.

As a Product Designer you will...

    • Work side-by-side with Product and Engineering to design new products and iterate on existing products
    • Be in constant communication with Scott’s Cheap Flights members to intimately understand and translate their wants and needs into meaningful products and experiences
    • Build and test prototypes early and often to validate and communicate ideas, and gain new insights along the way
    • Own the user journey across all Scott’s Cheap Flights touch points, including web, mobile, email, social, etc. and ensure they function well on their own, and as a whole
    • Translate winning prototypes and validated ideas into successful designs

Qualifications & Requirements:

    • 5+ years of experience launching successful consumer products across web, mobile apps and email
    • Portfolio showing off your best work
    • You’re customer obsessed: The customer matters most, and you do whatever it takes to understand and solve their problems, wants and needs
    • Excellent communication skills: You will be collaborating with other remote team members, stakeholders and our global community regularly
    • Familiarity with employing tools like surveys, emails, calls, and discussions to gather data and research
    • Data driven: You know what questions to ask using metrics to determine future decisions, and measure the performance of past decisions 
    • You enjoy being creative, resourceful and find it a personal mission to dissect and fully understand the problem before reaching a solution 
    • You are comfortable with ambiguity, unafraid of change and proactive

Nice to have skills:

    • Advanced HTML, CSS proficiency
    • Webflow experience (check out our dedicated job description for designers with Webflow experience)

What we value:

    • Be a team player
    • Embrace change
    • Advocate for members
    • Communicate clearly

Perks & Benefits:

    • Competitive compensation and stake in the success of the company
    • Unlimited PTO: We are a travel company, after all
    • 401k with a company match
    • Medical, dental, and vision coverage: Top-tier health insurance plans for you and your dependents (for US-based employees)
    • Paid family leave: 3 months of paid leave for you and your new family
    • Equipment: We'll make sure you have the hardware you need to succeed

We're a 100% remote team:

    • Our team is distributed around the globe and as a remote-only company we have all of the infrastructure in place to work well both synchronously and asynchronously including Slack, Zoom, Google Team Drive, Geekbot, etc.
    • Since we don't have any offices, nobody accidentally gets left out while the rest of the team huddles in a conference room or water cooler

Sound like an amazing fit?

We look forward to receiving your application. Be sure to include any information you think is relevant and why you’d be an excellent fit.

Apply now

About Scott's Cheap Flights

We're obsessed with helping people travel more often and discover new destinations by finding unpublished sales, mistake fares and incredible deals on international flights.

We live for the moments when we uncover deals like San Francisco to Hawaii for $177 round-trip (usually $900) or New York to New Zealand for $245 (usually $1,500).

1,500,000 global subscribers and growing.

Since opening our platform to the public in 2015, we've grown to over 1,500,000 subscribers around the world in large part thanks to our highly engaged community of evangelists. Every day we wake up to dozens of ecstatic messages and stories of impromptu getaways, surprise adventures and the ability to visit destinations that were prohibitively expensive.

Profitable from day one. 100% bootstrapped.

Our business model is simple and transparent: we offer free and premium subscriptions. Premium subscribers pay $39/year and get 100% of deals (free subscribers get ~ 1 in 3 deals), no ads in emails, and first dibs on emails. We don't get referral fees for any bookings, and our North Star is finding the best deals.

We're currently doing over $5,000,000 annual run rate. We've never taken venture capital, and instead focus on delivering as much value to subscribers as we can every day.

Do the best work of your life.

If your dream job is to be one of the founding members of an engineering team at a high-growth, remote company with product-market fit, we'd love to connect.

You'll work on a small (but growing!) team of developers that operate with limitless ownership, autonomy and room for growth. We value prior leadership experience, though by no means require anybody to be on a path toward management.

We're a 100% remote team and wouldn't have it any other way.

Unlike some remote roles, we don't have any offices, so you'll never be left out of the loop while a group of people in 'HQ' have an impromptu huddle in a conference room and make decisions while you're not there.

We rely heavily on Slack, Zoom, Google Team Drive, Geekbot asynchronous daily standups, JIRA and a few other cool tools to stay connected and in alignment.

The interview process.

We're a small team and move quickly. Step one is a brief chat with our recruiter, then a short (1-hour) design exercise, a call with our Product lead, a call with our engineers and final round chat with our co-founders, Scott and Brian. From there we'll discuss next steps, ask for a few references and get an offer out. Total time? Two weeks or less if we can align schedules.

Benefits

  • No commute! We're a fully remote team.
  • Incredible team of smart, passionate people.
  • Competitive salary and equity at profitable, bootstrapped company.
  • Generous health, vision and dental coverage (90% self + 50% dependent)

items.content:
XD Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: eLearning, Events
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: O'Reilly Media | No office location

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
design
adobe

Job description

About the Role

Reporting to the Lead Experience Designer, the Experience Designer (XD) collaborates with members of the Product, Engineering, and Creative teams to imagine and build user-centric learning experiences delivered via our online learning platform. Using a solve, learn, teach model, the platform helps individuals and teams find answers to in-the-moment technology challenges, develop deep expertise in hundreds of today's business and technology topics, and become highly-engaged life-long learners. The XD has a strong impact on how our millions of customers interact with learning experiences on our SaaS platform. The individual in this role will work as a team member in an agile squad supporting strategic projects. Candidates will apply design principles to assist various teams in producing clear and compelling visual communications.

About the O'Reilly Experience Design (XD) Creative Team

We are a hybrid (design and code) in-house agency, working on strategic XD projects across our online platform. We create user experiences that support and encourage learning for individuals and teams, across media, in alignment with the O'Reilly brand and our user’s desires.

In addition to XD product roadmap-driven sprints and ongoing day-to-day design support, we also collaborate with O'Reilly's marketing and creative teams. At its core, our creative team is focused on the delicate balance of ideas, aesthetics, messages, form, function—and brand. Because the best design is that which has a positive influence on the lives of our customers, we put understanding their needs and desires at the heart of everything we do.

About You

 As a Designer You Have:

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX experience designing large-scale (SaaS and/or ecommerce preferred) responsive products, high-content properties, and mobile applications for brands and/or media.
  • An analytical and visual mind, with a hunger for learning and a desire to solve complex human problems with technology.
  • Strong ability to refine designs through sketches, diagrams, wireframes, visual designs and interactive pieces.
  • A desire to challenge yourself both personally and professionally; as well as staying current with technology and interaction design trends.
  • Can-do attitude: accepts difficult challenges with curiosity, creativity, and dedication to craft. 

Role Responsibilities

Leverage core experience design and atomic design principles to weave iconography, typography, color, space, and texture together online to create an unparalleled learning experience on the O'Reilly platform.

  • Participate in user research and discovery on complex problems; speak with customers, get to know the problem space through research and iteration.
  • Design interfaces (and thus experiences) that inspire, engage, inform, and excite our customers.
  • Apply graphic and user-centered design principles to produce high-quality visuals—from concept to component-driven comps.
  • Collaborate with designers and creative team(s) across the company to continuously refine and center the O’Reilly design language, and create innovative, branded designs that people love viewing, using, and sharing with others.
  • Advocate for the user. Our users inform where we are going. Our teams focus on listening to users, and letting their needs guide us to the best solutions. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people.
  • Take full ownership of your work, and take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
  • Ability and willingness to communicate clearly with various stakeholders
  • Contribute to the evolution of the company's visual and experience style guide—including recommending data-inspired improvements and codifying usage rules on an ongoing basis.
  • Help build an exceptional XD team.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX design experience—preferably creating online learning related products
  • Online portfolio of work, demonstrating experience leading or managing the design of complex systems across multiple platforms, including mobile and touch-based interfaces.
  • Strong understanding of responsive design and web technologies.
  • Strong conceptualization and visual communication ability.
  • Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail.
  • Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps.
  • Expert knowledge of Sketch, Adobe CC Suite and associated design tools. Familiarity with HTML, CSS and JavaScript would also be helpful.
  • Proficient with user interface design patterns and standard user-centered design methodologies.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Understanding of common software product management practices.
  • Understanding of common software development practices.
  • Experience with inclusive and accessible design preferred.
Apply now

About O'Reilly Media

Inspiring the future for more than 40 years

We share the knowledge and teach the skills people need to change their world. For more than 40 years, O’Reilly has imparted the world-shaping ideas of innovators through books, articles, conferences, and our online learning platform.

When individuals, teams, and entire enterprises connect with the world's leading experts and content providers, anything is possible. Whether you're working to advance your career, be a better manager, or achieve the next breakthrough in technology or business, learning new skills is at the heart of it all.

With a range of formats including live online training courses, interactive tutorials, books, videos, and case studies, we equip all members of the workforce with the insight they need to stay ahead in an ever-changing economy.

Learning should not be measured in terms of usage, course completion, or certifications. Learning should be measured in terms of outcomes. We want to prepare people to solve challenging problems and inspire them with what’s possible for the future.  

Something we’ve been doing for over 40 years.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision insurance
  • Domestic partner coverage
  • Short and long-term disability insurance
  • Matching 401(k) plan
  • Paid time off for your birthday
  • Parental leave
  • Flexible sick time
  • Free O'Reilly books and subscription to learning platform
  • Flexible spending accounts

Job description

Technical Coach (Design) 
 Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin



Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.
  • Remote .
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.
Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 300 developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours

HTML5 / Web Designer (React/Redux Pref.)

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Big Data, Developer APIs, Sports betting odds algorithms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Core Data | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
user-interface
html

Job description

This position is for a quick turnaround project for a highly skilled individual. If that's you and you have a portfolio to back that up, feel free to quote your hourly or project rate upfront.

Core Data currently needs an additional HTML5 web designer with react and redux experience to create a major expansion on the company's HTML5-based UI. The existing UI can be seen at this link. The existing UI is focused on displaying available offers for live (actively in play) sports games and uses a simplified navigation scheme where the user simply selects a sport, then a game, and ultimately selects what wagers are wanted.

The candidate will need to expand this User Interface to include "prematch" betting. Mockup designs for this have already been prepared here. The enhancement will keep all existing functionality of the live UI, but add a tab/screen for upcoming games that have not yet started. The list of available prematch games is numerous (sometimes in the thousands) and so the navigation scheme will be much more sophisticated than the live (current) navigation scheme. The company's goal is to have a clean, smooth, and intuitive cross-browser product.

The candidate will be expected to combine their knowledge of aesthetics and intuitive UX principles to create a cutting-edge, crisp, and attractive prematch expansion to the company's UI. The existing UI uses React.JS and Redux, so prior experience with these frameworks is necessary. The backend data to power the UI is provided vi a WebSockets feed and our backend team can make reasonable changes to the feed format if it is necessary to facilitate a speedy project completion.

Apply now

About Core Data

First and foremost, we are a software development company owned and operated entirely by professionals with a strong technical background.  Since technology is our core focus and software is our principal product, all projects at CDS are important and recognized by the highest levels of management.

We believe in hiring the best candidates for every position.  It is for this reason that we do not restrict ourselves to arbitrary geographical locations.  Most of our staff works on a remote basis.  Our hiring decisions are based on one's abilities, not location.

The projects we take on run the gamut.  Primarily we are a data and statistics provider with an emphasis on low-latency, real-time data feeds. 

Benefits

  • Monthly paid time off
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible hours / work schedules

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Designer
Industry: Information Technology, SaaS, Web Technology

Remote details

html
css
