Job description

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application now, is looking for a Web Designer and Developer to add to the team.

Formstack is a 12-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds.

Who You Are:

You love to create beautiful web designs, and also have a deep understanding of how a design system should work and feel. You are not afraid to take risks in your creativity. You have a passion for expertly representing your brand through your designs.

What You Will Do:

You will work closely with our Marketing team to create experiences that propel our brand forward. You will be active in making and collaborating on core design decisions and development patterns throughout projects, and must be willing to take creative risks, experiment with new ideas and approaches, and do whatever it takes to create the best and most creative work possible.

How You Will Succeed:

  • Design and build everything from style guides and page templates, to rich banner ads and marketing materials.
  • Design across multiple brands, understanding the value propositions and nuances of each.
  • Participate in design and development discussions across departments (including Marketing and Product).
  • Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to understand user needs, business goals, technical constraints, and other project facets.
  • Establish approaches to creating scalable, repeatable, and responsive design elements across devices.
  • Showcase modern graphical standards and processes (think SVG and CSS animation).
  • Learn about and discuss emerging design trends and techniques.

What We Are Looking For:

  • Exceptional attention to detail & ability to meet deadlines
  • HTML5 / CSS3 prowess
  • Adobe Suite products and/or equivalents (SublimeText, Sketch, etc.)
  • Experience with Design Systems
  • Google Analytics experience
  • Solid web portfolio showcasing web design work
  • SaaS Experience
  • Working with responsive frameworks
  • Github experience

Bonus Points:

  • A/B testing & SEO experience
  • Foundation or Bootstrap
  • PHP

What Formstack Offers:

  • 100% covered Medical Insurance, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees.
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Check out this video and apply if you want to jump into the next great chapter of your life.

Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles.

Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

Apply now

Benefits

  • The most up-to-date software
  • 401k Safe Harbor Match
  • Lunch everyday paid for by Formstack (for employees in Indianapolis)
  • Generous PTO policy
  • Remote working office
  • All the snacks you can handle
  • Company-contributions to HSA
  • Monthly company "fun"
  • Yearly team-building event for the whole company
  • All the pings and pongs you can handle!

items.content:
UI/UX Designer

Headquarters: Remote
URL: https://www.overlaphealth.com/blog/2018/08/09/hiring-ui-ux-designer/

Overlap makes healthcare better for patients and their providers. We work with some of the world’s best healthcare institutions to help them get data from wearables and mobile apps into the clinical environment so they can manage disease more effectively.  The Overlap product line spans iOS, Android and Web and has deep data visualization components.

As our part-time UI/UX Designer, we want your experience to help turn ideas into engaging experiences that are implementable.

About you:
  • You are self-managed, know how to prioritize, meet deadlines and define deliverables.
  • You can effectively communicate and present your design thinking to teams and stakeholders
  • You can take a design from high-level concept to Sketch and Invision and static assets easily and quickly
  • You write and speak English clearly
  • Your are up-to-date on industry trends in UI and UX
  • You are honest - You know what you don’t know and you have no problem raising your hand and asking for help.
  • You’re obsessed with simplicity and consistency
  • You’re okay working across the organization (product leadership, engineering, marketing and the CEO)
  • You have knowledge of design trends in mobile and how to adapt designs across platforms
  • You have experience working with visualizing large sets of data
  • You have previous remote working experience

You will be:
  • Collaborating with Overlap’s CTO, product lead engineers and CEO to align partner needs with company goals
  • Augmenting UI and UX across our iOS, Android and Web application
  • Working-off of our existing design UI on iOS, Android and Web
  • Designing some marketing collateral and new features for the overlaphealth.com website
  • Participating in project planning and project review (QA and post-mortems)
  • Designing everything from logos to icons to QA’ing final work and assist with acceptance testing
  • Focusing on shipping a beautiful product you’re proud of

Role requirements:
  • 3+ years of experience
  • Most recent portfolio demonstrating both design skill and process across mobile and web
  • Design experience with data visualization
  • Experience in creating easy-to-use designs that display holistic thinking
  • Acute attention to detail
  • Experience with and proficiency in design and prototyping software (Sketch, Invision)
  • Stellar presentation skills
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) skills

Software skills
  • Sketch
  • Prototyping & wireframing software
  • Invision

To apply: Send along a resume and cover letter explaining why you’d be a good fit for Overlap and a resume. Email everything to jointheteam@overlaphealth.com, please include "UI/UX Designer” in the subject line. We look forward to hear from you!

items.content:
Job Description

Optuno is a web design and development company that provides 100% customized, stress-free websites for businesses for a fraction of the cost of going to a traditional web design firm. The company grew out of a desperate need for professional, streamlined and affordable website development. Optuno provides a unique, stress-free and fully-managed experience for the creation, maintenance and marketing of websites.

You will be working with a virtual team to deliver awesome, customized websites to our clients, interfacing between our clients and our website development team.

We are a fast-paced, fast growing company looking for someone who can keep up the pace. Drop us a line if you can manage projects efficiently, are extremely organized, a wizard at multi-tasking, can think through problems and develop solutions, and can work at breakneck speeds with a keen eye for detail. Did we mention you will be communicating to our clients? That means, we need a natural problem solver and someone who can communicate in a way to build relationships, offer support and anticipate needs.

Previous experience in website design and development. on-page SEO, and copywriting is mandatory, however, we are looking for someone with a strong ability to manage projects and interact with clients. This is a great opportunity for a professional with a few years of experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage multiple projects at one time, while delivering amazing customer service
  • Collaborate with clients to determine website requirements
  • Provide web design and development team with information to create websites, filling in any missing information 
  • Assign milestones and maintain schedule for each project
  • Update client and team on milestones and timelines
  • Perform content or visual updates to websites, as needed
  • Review project work to ensure the highest level of quality
  • Research, createand apply meta data to websites
  • Develop content for websites
  • Troubleshoot technical problems related to client’s website or Optuno platform
  • Able to work remotely

Requirements 

  • Proficiency in HTML and principles of web design and development
  • Experience using Wordpress (content updates and design tweaks)
  • Experience multi-tasking across a variety of projects
  • Former experience in web development, design, or experience planning preferred.
  • Experience with applying On-Page SEO to websites
  • Experience writing Meta Data for websites
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with minimal direction.
  • Ability to work and communicate with a diverse range of people and clients.
  • Availability to work Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM.

Compensation

$10-15/hour (Based on Level of Experience) + Bonuses (Based on Performance)

 

Our Values

Optuno is a fast-paced environment. Here are our values. If you value these things, too, then we hope you will apply!

·         Excellence: We strive for pixel-perfect work. Details are important.

·         Problem-Solver: We dive in and figure things out.

·         Zeal for Clients: This is our business. We help our clients develop websites, every step of the way, with an upbeat attitude.

·         Honesty: We provide truth wrapped in kindness topped with a helpful approach.

Although this position doesn’t have supervisory duties, you will be directing the project related activities of the web design and development team.

items.title: Product Designer (UX and UI)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Product Designer (UX and UI)

Headquarters: Remote
URL: https://www.crazyegg.com/

Since 2005, over 300,000 websites have used Crazy Egg to understand how their audience experiences their website and their product. We are pioneers in data visualization and in helping businesses get immense value quickly and accurately from incredibly large data sets. That's what we love to do. We are looking for a Product Designer with strong UX and UI skills to help build on that foundation and take our product experience to the next level.

Crazy Egg Product Designers care about the customer experience, and do what it takes to bring that experience fully to life. You work directly with clients to determine their needs and work across the team through prototyping/development. You design user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes. You get your hands dirty doing everything from icons and logos to QA’ing final work and assisting with acceptance testing. You make sure what you discovered and designed, is delivered.

A successful team member at Crazy Egg is:
  • Direct, undeniable, customer impact. We have incredible customers that we're grateful for and we believe the best teammates are the ones who, regardless of function or discipline, are eager and excited to find a way to connect their work directly to customers.
  • Independent and interdependent. You are fully trusted as a full owner of the work you do; self-determined, responsible, accountable, and celebrated. With that freedom, you acknowledge, a broader social context. We work together, we partner, we collaborate, and we make sure the work we take on and hand off is done thoughtfully and with care.
  • Assuming positive intent. All outcomes may not be what we desired, what we expected, or what we needed. But they happened because people take chances and are willing to make decisions. We assume people try their hardest and try their best, we assume their actions started with the most positive of intentions. Every conversation, assessment, piece of feedback, starts with that assumption, on both sides. This ensures our team is built on a foundation of trust.
  • Caring and inclusive; sincerely. We work at Crazy Egg because we believe in the opportunity, we believe in the vision, we believe in our people, and we believe in our ability to build something wonderful. It is those beliefs that also mean we care about the market, we care about the vision, we care about each other, and we care about building something wonderful. When all of this falls into place, our customers are able to build better businesses and succeed.

A successful Product Designer at Crazy Egg has:
  • The ability to work across the organization (Product Leadership, Engineering, Growth) to develop new experience-focused web applications, or provide support for existing ones.
  • The knowledge of a thoughtful, balanced customer research process required to balance clear customer feedback with intuiting and addressing the unsaid or unwritten.
  • The passion to take a project from high-level concept (business requirements or functional requirements) through to implementation ready designs. Your ability to move seamlessly from InVision to Sketch to the Front End is standout.
  • The expertise on the expected (current web standards, original designs, rapid prototyping, responsive design, cross-screen/cross-device) with a commitment to staying abreast of emerging UX and UI trends as a way to keep making your work and our customer’s experience, more helpful.
  • The willingness to participate in project planning (scoping, estimating) and project review (QA, post-mortems) showcases your desire to keep improving how we work together and what we deliver to our customers.

A successful applicant for this position typically has:
  • 3+ years experience in a product design role.
  • 2+ years experience using qualitative & quantitative customer research to inform design direction.
  • 2+ years experience with the tools required for rapid prototyping and iterative design.
  • Previous remote working experience.
  • Motivation to work for a company that is bootstrapped, self-funded, and profitable for 14 years.

A successful applicant would likely have some but not all of the following:
  • Working in a startup environment
  • Working on applications that process large volumes of data and/or receive high volumes of traffic
  • Passion or desire to become more active with Front End Engineering and Development.

As a Crazy Egg team member here’s what you’ll become a part of:
  • We believe in building the best team possible, regardless of geographic location. Our team is fully remote and we believe in working where you’re the most productive and happiest.
  • We have full trust in you and believe in finding a good balance. Work should be a marathon, not a sprint, and so we offer flexible paid vacation.
  • We believe in supporting your growth and opportunity. Crazy Egg was founded 14 years ago by accomplished founders Hiten Shah and Neil Patel. If you are looking to learn what it takes to one day break off on your own and start your own startup, this is a good opportunity for you.

Direct applicants only. No recruiters or agencies please.

To apply: Please send an email introducing yourself to jobs@crazyegg.com. Please include the following:1) A link to your portfolio and resume.2) Some background on why you want to work for Crazy Egg.3) A quick overview of your favorite product from a design standpoint, and why.

items.content:
Junior Designer

Full-time
Manalapan, NJ
Remote job
Small business
Posted Sep 6 – Accepting applications

PRI is a close-knit team of smart, creative professionals. We love what we do, and we love to work together. We’re looking for a curious Junior Designer who thrives in a deeply collaborative environment. You obsess over beautifully crafted experiences, love solving challenging problems, and diving head first into something new. You have a diverse background and your skills extend from digital through to print and typography. You build meaningful relationships with your coworkers that bring ideas to life in new and innovative ways.

Who are we? We’re a well-respected digital agency based out of New Jersey. Known for our deep strategic thinking, we create comprehensive web experiences that span across channels (web, mobile, and social). Innovation is at the core of our colleague relationships and client work – not just for the sake of innovation, but to elevate the end users’ experiences and exceed our clients’ unique goals.

Not in New Jersey? Not a problem, we’re a distributed team.

Responsibilities

You will work on a variety of products, including websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions, corporate identity, social media graphics, etc. and you will collaborate with our entire team.

  • Work well with other designers and creatives in a collaborative setting
  • Take direction and communicate with Art Director and senior team members to receive feedback
  • Support the team throughout the execution of campaigns and projects
  • Take the design “brief” to record requirements and clients’ needs
  • Work with a wide range of media and be able to work on both print and digital (web and email) products as needed by the team
  • Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts
  • Prepare well thought out mockups and rough drafts and be able to articulate your ideas
  • Amend final designs to clients’ comments and gain full approval
  • Work as part of a team with copywriters, designers, stylists, executives etc.

Requirements

  • EXCELLENT communication skills (written, verbal, documentation) - as a distributed team, we communicate a lot online throughout our entire day so it’s important that you’re comfortable with that!
  • Ability to work well with a team and take direction
  • Willingness to work on a large variety of projects
  • Proficiency in Adobe Products (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, etc.)
  • Ability to see print projects through prepress to commercial printing
  • Skilled in wireframing and concept or prototype design
  • Passion in solving design problems, both UX and print, with creativity & users in mind
  • Interest in UX and practicing user-centered design techniques
  • Have a general knowledge and understanding of social media platforms
  • Obsession with quality and extraordinary visual design talent with a pixel­-level attention for details
  • Organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects and tasks
  • Excellent design sensibilities and an interest in improving skills/continued education
  • Ability to work as part of a distributed team and have discipline to work from remote location
  • Meet tight deadlines for projects
  • Provide daily updates and progress as required

Education and Experience

  • 1­ to 3 years relevant experience
  • College graduates, design degree preferred (must provide portfolio or work samples)

Summary

Covenant Eyes exists to help people be free from pornography. We provide software and content to help people quit using pornography for good, or never start. The company is 18 years old and has a history of great success, but we have our work cut out for us, with a service that spans multiple web and email channels, and applications on Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android, and we’re in the midst of retooling for our next generation AI-powered porn-monitoring systems. We have an existing UX staff of 11, split across 2 design teams, a research team, and an internal services team, and we need help keeping up with the workload. That’s why we want you.

 

You’d be…

·       Redefining the way customers interact with and manage their experience with our service. Re-architecting the structure of our account management portal, redesigning the critical interactions, and providing an outstanding new UI design so customers fall head-over-heals in love with it.

·       Creating a simple and highly efficient sign up and onboarding experience from the ground up. Pioneering ways of boosting account health and customer satisfaction from first-interaction through the first few years of use.

·       Contributing to and refining our design system by regularly interacting with it and suggesting modifications, additions and patterns.

·       Overhauling our software interfaces to reflect a seamless experience that increases user control and clarity on all of our desktop and mobile platforms.

·       Providing feedback to other designers, stakeholders and project managers on design and implementation.

 

We want you because…

•       You are eager to be a part of something bigger than yourself, impacting culture so people can live full and happy lives, free from pornography.

•       You have designed end-to-end experiences, tested and worked through successful implementation on them.

•       You have close relationships with developers, helping them to see your vision and inspire them to build your designs in a way that captures your intent.

•       You spend time with stakeholders understanding their needs so you can deliver value to them.

•       You have experience observing and testing your designs with users, leading to iteration and better design solutions.

•       You regularly apply good design practices that include multiple design options and choosing the best path forward.

•       You are a life-long learner, finding ways to study and grow on a regular cycle.

•       You know how to document, communicate and sell your design work.

•       You are experienced with the latest industry tools like Sketch, InVision, and the Adobe Creative Suite.

•       You have experience using, contributing to, and maintaining design systems.

 

Notes

Though we’re a remote-friendly team, we are only considering US-based applicants. You are also able to travel to headquarters in Owosso, Michigan 3-4 times year.

 

How to Apply

Please submit samples of your best work showing the breadth and depth UX design skills, with a resume demonstrating that experience. We look forward to hearing from you!

items.content:
*Company Description*

This a great chance to join a hugely exciting small business based in Edinburgh and have a direct influence on where our product and company are headed. From day one, you will be a critical member of our growing team. We are hugely passionate about the business we have built, and we are very excited about the projects we have lined up, which will open doors to lots of exciting global opportunities.

We’re growing fast, and shipping software just as fast - you will need to be able to execute efficiently and swiftly. If you’re passionate about creating user-friendly interfaces, we’d love to meet you.

*Job Description*
We are looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer who possesses a real passion for understanding the world of our users, generating insights and designing solutions that empower them to accomplish tasks through our product.

Our products include responsive web applications, search engines, APIs, machine learning, online payments, image recognition and native apps.

Responsibilities

* Produce designs for new and existing features and products through wireframes, visual comps, prototypes, and design specifications.
* Participate in product ideation and concept development using an iterative, user-centered design process.
* Articulate how a design solution fits into an overall narrative and addresses an unmet user or business need.
* Define holistic solutions and understand system-level implications of design decisions.
* Develop high-level concepts that consider the user, business, technology constraints, and insights gathered through research and testing.
* Validate and improve designs using both qualitative and quantitative methods, through close collaboration with development and product managers.
* Uphold product quality by ensuring that design solutions are implemented as intended, through close collaboration with product and development teams.
* Help out with general marketing needs such as email design, animations, video.

*Qualifications*
* Familiarity working in Sketch, Zeplin, and Adobe Creative Suite
* Portfolio demonstrating knowledge of visual and user experience design
* Experience prototyping, wireframing, and vetting ideas with both users and internal stakeholders.
* Experience designing web-based software applications
* Understanding of Agile methodology
* Some knowledge of CSS and HTML is desirable
* Understanding of native iOS / Android design patterns is desirable

*Benefits*
* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for travelling and remote working
* Comprehensive benefits package and flexible working + work-life balance driven environment.
* Options pool
* Opportunity to work in our shared office with one of Scotland's most exciting tech companies (with free parking)
* Free drinks and coffee
* Opportunity to bring your pooch with you to work

items.content:
Senior UX Designer // Trifacta

Company: Trifacta

Tags:
  • UX
  • Data
  • enterprise

    • Senior UX Designer – Berlin

    Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.

    About Us

    At Trifacta, we’re designing a product for a growing group of users who have a very real pain. Cleaning and structuring data is both a crucial and difficult activity, a process that traditionally requires a huge amount of time and effort. We believe that transforming data shouldn’t be a painful problem and that user-centered design is particularly well suited to creating simple, intuitive, and enjoyable solutions. This is a lofty goal in a space that is traditionally deprived of usable products.

    As designers, we recognize, perhaps more than anybody else, the value of professional tools capable not only to accommodate our needs but also to empower and inspire us in our everyday work. Our mission (and our passion) is providing our users with these same great experiences. And our target users are tough ones: smart, skilled, incredibly task-driven data analysts with unique mental models. We are facing big challenges here: building modern data tools for a large variety of users and needs in a complex and incredibly dynamic context. How can we support them in the shift from spreadsheets to the complexity of big data? How can we give users the ability to understand the impact of their work across data, projects, and organizations?

    We are looking for a talented Senior UX Designer to help us tackling these hard challenges by working from the beginning to the end of product building, from generating new ideas to crafting detailed microinteractions. You will participate in the definition of a new generation of products capable of combining user inputs and machine learning technologies to accomplish complex tasks in simple, enjoyable ways. Come be part of an incredibly passionate, talented and diverse team in which collaboration and mutual respect are key.

    Responsibilities

    • You will articulate and convey designs via scenarios, sketches, storyboards and presentations, lo- and hi-fi mockups, detailed interaction specs, prototypes or animations.
    • You’ll drive your designs forward through every step of the design process and know what details matter at each stage: formative research, conceptual and interaction design, prototyping, and usability studies. Through this process we’d rather you show than tell.
    • You will work closely with PMs to discover and understand user needs and requirements. We hope you can help us defining what we should build, not just how to build it.
    • You will work closely with engineers to understand technical considerations and implement our designs down to the last detail.
    • You will contribute to the design, documentation and publishing of our design system.
    • Our company and processes are ever-changing, so we hope you can embrace and influence the change to make Trifacta a better place.

    Requirements

    • You have a minimum of 3 years of industry experience in product design with a proven track record of success. You can share several great examples of real work you’ve shipped, and what you learned along the way.
    • You’ve shipped enterprise products and you feel comfortable working with and for data, juggling technical constraints and gnarly details. You know how to work with and motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right.
    • You’re a generalist with a strong focus on UI and UX. You are passionate about building users interfaces and crafting beautiful and intuitive interactions leveraging the latest web technologies.
    • You have thorough knowledge and experience across a range of design approaches, methodologies and prototyping skills.
    • You obsess over details and are excited to polish until your work is pixel-perfect.
    • You have strong written & verbal communication and presentation skills. You are able to effectively structure and share your work in an international setup with 6+ hours of time difference, frequent asynchronous communications, remote design reviews, etc..
    • You are able to manage and work on multiple projects simultaneously.
    • Our team deeply values collaboration. You are passionate and committed to working with other designers and across disciplines to drive change into products. You’re confident, but willing to learn. We want to learn from you too!

    Benefits and Perks of working at Trifacta

    • You will work on an international, friendly team on one of the most exciting opportunities in the data space.
    • We will help you grow your skills through mentorships and education support. Our environment is focused on collaboration and learning
    • You will work from our brand-new offices in Berlin Mitte
    • We value work/life balance
    • We have monthly team events
    • You can visit our headquarters in San Francisco at least once a year
    • We offer relocation support
    Apply for this position

Cinemagraphs are eye-catchers and can be used effectively in online marketing and outdoor advertising. Companies can easily license stock cinemagraphs on our platform. We also work with brands to create custom cinemagraphs for their campaigns.

    The Job At Hand

    We’re looking for an A&R to onboard new content creators to our platform. You will be provided with a list of leads (i.e. potential creators) and asked to reach out to them via email. If they signal an interest in joining our platform, you will set up a video call and brief them on our licensing terms and other key points. Once they have registered, you will guide them through the process of submitting their work and having their profile activated on our site. You will be remunerated for every profile activation.

    Remuneration: 30 Euros per profile activation

    Location: Remote

    Starting Date: As soon as possible

    Your Responsibilities

    • Reach out to content creators by email
    • Set up and carry out video calls with content creators
    • Guide them through the submission process

    Requirements

    • Open and friendly personality
    • Strong communicator, especially in English
    • An interest in visual media and cinemagraphs
    • Previous sales, community management or A&R experience are a bonus

    Please apply with a CV, a photo and a few sentences explaining why you wish to work with us. Include “A&R” in the subject line of your email. We look forward to hearing from you!

    Apply for this position

The Brigade is a digital agency with a passion for user-centered design, great art and formidable technology.  We create remarkable digital products and experiences.

We’re looking for a curious Senior Designer who thrives in a deeply collaborative environment.  You obsess over beautifully crafted experiences, love solving challenging problems, and diving head first into something new.  You have a diverse background and your skills extend from digital through to print and typography.  You build meaningful relationships with your co-conspirators that bring ideas to life in ways that are more incredible that any of us could have imagined.

items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Full-time
Portland
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Aug 15 – Accepting applications

About SurveyMonkey

Founded in 1999 and based in San Mateo, California, SurveyMonkey is the world’s leading platform for turning people’s voices and opinions into actionable data — People Powered Data. Whether it’s with customers, employees, or a target market, SurveyMonkey helps curious individuals and companies — including 99% of the Fortune 500 — have conversations at scale with the people who matter most. It’s People Powered Data that allows them to understand not only “what” is happening, but “why.” SurveyMonkey’s 700+ employees throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific are dedicated to powering the curious.

 

About SurveyMonkey Business Solutions

SurveyMonkey is the world’s most popular survey platform. While it is a great general-purpose tool used by millions, there is ample opportunity for more specialized solutions. That’s where we come in. We build standalone, targeted SaaS products that bring great UX to solving more specific business problems.

To date, our 12-person team has shipped three products:

  • SurveyMonkey CX - Measure and improve customer satisfaction
  • SurveyMonkey Engage - Understand and foster employee engagement
  • TechValidate - Source and publish 3rd-party verified customer proof

We’re on a mission to bring better design to the business world, and while we’re at it we’d like to make our mark with stunning data viz, personable interfaces, and a commitment to empathizing with our users.

 

Who We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a talented designer with demonstrable experience working on user-friendly SaaS applications. Your portfolio should demonstrate the ability to design for all screen sizes from mobile to desktop. You should also be comfortable writing clear, concise UI copy.

Strong visual design, product design, usability, and communication skills are essential. Technical skills such as CSS, Javascript, and familiarity with Ruby on Rails are also a strong plus, though not required. Experience contributing to a central design system is a major plus and you will have opportunity to participate as we evolve ours.

If you’re jazzed about making really complex things super simple we should talk. If you’re interested in creating the future of intuitive data visualization (and have an opinion on what that means) we should talk. If you believe that great design belongs everywhere and have the mettle to make it happen, we should definitely talk.

 

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience on a product design team working across the entire product development lifecycle and successfully shipping products.
  • Experience working effectively with cross-functional teams including shepherding designs through the development process.
  • Experience collaborating with other designers to create a cohesive cross-product experience, both leveraging and contributing to a centralized design system.
  • Solid user-centered design fundamentals with information architecture, interaction design and visual design skills and the ability to quickly produce high quality deliverables across the range of disciplines.
  • Demonstrated ability to write clear, effective UI copy.
  • Ability to present design solutions at all levels of the organization with clear, articulate rationale.
  • Proficient with Sketch, Invision, Creative Suite, and knowledgeable about HTML, CSS, modern browser technologies, and cross-device design.
  • Portfolio showcasing examples of product design work.

 

Why Work Here?

We are a remote team. As long as your work day overlaps the Pacific timezone by at least four hours, where you live and work and up to you. We’re not strangers though — in addition to a sane amount of video calls, we meet up quarterly to get to know each other better and have some fun. In the past year, we’ve been bowling in Phoenix, made sushi in San Francisco, and toured a brewery.

We are strong believers in work-life balance. We know world class work can be done in just forty hours a week when distractions are minimized and the pace is sustainable. As such, you will be expected to be a manager of one.

Naturally, we offer competitive salaries and annual bonuses, medical/dental benefits, generous PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and meaningful equity compensation. We also supply you with top of the line equipment for your home office.

Finally, in a world of clunky “enterprise” software, we consider great UX and visual design to be a strategic advantage, and we need you to help us keep improving. Our track record gives our team a lot of autonomy — this is your chance to rethink how “business solutions” should look and function, and to have fun while doing it.

Join us.

 

At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays and parental leave, and equity compensation.

SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We use North Pass as our Learning Management System and have been adding content but not in a cohesive way. We are looking for someone to revamp our training to make it clean, fun and engaging.

*Responsibilities*

* Plan, organize and deliver training programmes
* Work with Key Account Managers to gather client specific training requirements
* Design bespoke online training programmes (that match our employer's needs)
* Make sure all courses are always up to date, comply with any new regulations and coordinate with industry experts so we have the best content

items.content:
UI/UX Designer

USA

full-time

Autosoft, Inc. (www.autosoftdms.com) is a Dealership Management System (DMS) software company serving the retail automotive industry for 30 years. At Autosoft, we embrace change, encourage out of the box thinking, and listen to our employees to help shape the future of our business.

We currently have an opening for an UI/UX Designer that will work with cross-functional teams to develop designs for SaaS applications.

Who You Are:

As an UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for creating intuitive, visually appealing and effective designs for Autosoft products across PC, tablet, and mobile platforms, working with both product development and marketing.

What You’ll Do:
  • Develop, communicate, and implement user experience vision and UI framework for features across desktop, IOS and Android applications for current and next generation products
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product management, development and marketing to take features from concept to launch
  • Document design solutions using sketches, wireframes, flows, and pixel-perfect mocks
  • Deliver detailed designs and components to agile development teams and refine as necessary during product sprints
  • Maintaining vision and understanding of UI/UX trends in the ever-changing SaaS environment
  • Prototype designs as needed for user research and tests
  • Create and maintain style guides and UI pattern libraries
What You’ll Need:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or related field
  • Minimum three (3) years of experience in software UI/UX or web design
  • Demonstrated success working with Creative and/or Marketing leads to establish and execute on program vision
  • Expertise in wireframing and visual design tools such as Axure, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, is expected.
  • Strong visual design sense, clean command over typography, interaction design, and usability
  • Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS
  • Well versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines and principles
  • Experience with responsive design methods and development of design iterations
  • Deep understanding of user-centered design methodologies
  • Ability to visualize, own, and execute the creation of an experience from initial concept to implementation

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
We’re looking for an early career user-centred UX Designer to join a fast growing fintech startup.

At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online. We currently do this by giving regulated businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customers - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, without ever having met in person.

And this is just the beginning - our technology allows us to define what ‘trust’ means across the digital economy. Our long term aim is to create a single network where people and businesses can share their digital identity securely and interchangeably - whether they’re applying for a mortgage, listing on the stock market, or applying for a new job. We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

You’ll work with our Lead Designer to help solve complex user-software problems. You’ll be a voice for our users and their needs. An internal champion for exceptional product quality and the need for cohesive experiences.

On a day-to-day basis you’ll be involved in all parts of the design process. You’ll take part in user research, uncovering and documenting under served user needs. You’ll go wide in looking for solutions to user problems, generating multiple low-fidelity potential solutions.

Using your inclusive, open and transparent approach to work, you’ll seek out feedback from users, designers, product managers and engineers throughout the design process, receiving in good faith and using new insights to inform the direction of your work.

Your solutions will be simple and elegant and make use of the PassFort design system which you will help to maintain and extend when necessary.

We see this as a development role, and if you’re driven and motivated to learn and take on more responsibility, the opportunity will be here!

What we’re looking for

Strong interaction design skills: You’ll have an understanding of multi-step and cross-platform flows. Proficiency in sketching and wireframing simple features and user journeys, and an understanding for the need to design for different potential states (errors, successes, dead-ends).
Understanding of how user research fits into the design process: You’ll be aware of different methodologies and when to use them.
Understanding of visual design fundamentals: layout, visual hierarchy, colour, typography, and iconography.
Desire to continually learn, develop your skills and evolve as a designer and have the confidence and maturity to experiment with new research and design approaches as well as new methods and tooling.
Ability to be comfortable with, and embrace ambiguity.
Working knowledge of Sketch.
A portfolio showing your process and decision-making skills, as well as the final deliverables.

The Perks!
Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
Great location - we’re central to three stations, and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
Dental cover
Access to Perkbox - discounts to services and products (and honestly it’s fantastic)
Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
Generous holiday entitlement
Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
Pick your own equipment and kit
Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

If you're interested in applying, please also submit either a link (or file) to your portfolio

items.content:
Tigerspike is one of the largest specialised enterprise mobility companies in the world that solves complex business problems by creating mobile and digital products, which improve people’s lives.

We are looking for a UX Designer with commercial experience, who is eager to learn and wants to work on a variety of projects, to join us.

You'll learn the Tigerspike XD methodology, grow your skills, knowledge and experience across a diverse range of industries, creating best in class digital products.

*The Role*
We’re looking for thinkers, problem solvers and lovers of all things design to join our rapidly growing team.

You will work closely with our highly experienced designers and have ample opportunity to watch, listen and learn and from them. You will follow their lead whilst they teach and mentor you to help execute on their strategy and be instrumental in getting deliverables to the finish line.

As a UX Designer, your primary tool at Tigerspike will be your empathy with users, thinking power and understanding of human behaviour and psychology.

You will be a part of a cross-functional team; assisting in user research activities, conceptualising solutions based on research insights and creating task flows and wireframes.

*You'll like working with us if you:*

*Love solving problems

*Thrive in a fast-paced, but highly collaborative environment

*Like the flexibility of working from home/ from a coffee shop at times

*Want to work for a global company and have the opportunity to work in one of our other offices (e.g Sydney, Singapore, Dubai)

*Like having free lunch and drinks every Friday

*Fancy free Bootcamp or Yoga class every week

*Want to enjoy 25 days holidays per year (on top of public holidays)

*Would like having a £60 monthly mobile phone allowance

*Value learning new skills through personal and professional training allowance

*This job might be for you if you:*

*Have some professional work experience as a UX Designer

*Can inspire clients and turn ideas into world-class experiences

*Have the innate ability to empathise with people and appreciate their context, culture and habits

*Can work around and find creative solutions within constraints

*Are comfortable following direction, but have self-motivation to use your initiative

*Have experience designing for small screens as well as big screens

*Can effectively communicate solution ideas to stakeholders as well as team members

*Have an understanding of & appreciation for the context, medium & platforms you’re designing for

*Even more awesome if you have:*

*Professional work experience in a similar environment
*Knowledge of User Centered Design principles
*Experience gathering requirements through workshops, interviews and research

*More About Us*
Tigerspike is a digital products company improving people’s lives through technology. Focusing on strategy, experience design, development and systems integration, our work is hinged on five key values: Transparency, Resilience, Problem-solving, Energy and Curiosity. We have a reputation for innovation and creating long-term partnerships with customers such as Emirates, American Express, The United Nations, Westfield, ADP and New Look.

Our People are our culture and that is what makes us unique. Founded in 2003 with a team spanning 10 global offices and counting, we are excited to continue supporting businesses #TheTigerspikeWay.



_We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status._

items.content:
Inspiral is a venture-backed company that empowers people around the world to share knowledge and skills instantly. Become a cook, fix appliances, assemble furniture - learn any task in seconds. Instant knowledge. Practical science fiction.

We are a unique founding team featuring a unicorn founder, a growth hacker, and a technology wizard. As a cherry on top, we are lucky to be joined by an incredible advisory board and support network featuring some of London’s top entrepreneurs.

With our platform, we are looking to reshape the user behavior of a generation, which is why we are looking for a genius UX/UI Designer to join our small team and help shape the future of instant education.

For this role we ideally look for:
* Passion for tech-for-good products and building something meaningful
* User-centric, feedback-driven, iterative approach to problem-solving
* Experience designing mobile and web applications
* Ability to deliver designs which can be easily translated into code
* Understanding of social media platforms and their experience
* Proactive attitude towards your work
* Creativity and ability to learn fast

Nice to have’s:
* Experience in branding and story-telling
* Previous projects in collaboration with mobile developers
* Rapid prototyping skills using Marvel, Invision, or similar tools
* Enthusiasm for content creation on platforms like Snapchat, Instagram, Youtube

In your application please include:
* Any online profiles (LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.)
* A description of your professional experience (LinkedIn, CV, or similar)
* No long cover letter needed (we prefer meeting you)

We love people with experience. But even more, we love people who love our open culture and working together as a team. We are looking for ambitious self-starters with a growth mindset who are enthusiastic about our mission and think on a truly global scale.

You will be working directly together with the co-founding team featuring one of Europe’s top tech entrepreneurs. If you love creating the future of instant education as much as we do - apply now and let’s grab a coffee!

Skills:
Mobile Application Design, Rapid Prototyping, UI/UX Design, Logo and Branding Design
